title: True statements about genes with 5 answer options

content.prompt: Which of the following statements concerning a gene is correct?

choices.label: A gene can code for a specific protein.
A gene can exist in alternate forms called introns.
A gene undergoes crossing-over during DNA replication.
A gene that is very similar in sequence in a human and in a bacterium is probably a recent mutation.
A gene that is expressed in every offspring of every generation is recessive.
